ζ𝜁\zeta Set of clusters
X¯¯𝑋\bar{X} The average processing utilization of selected clients

F​(x)𝐹𝑥F(x) Multi-objective optimization function
𝐰¯aL,ζzd,ksuperscriptsubscript¯𝐰subscript𝑎𝐿subscript𝜁𝑧𝑑𝑘\bar{\mathbf{w}}_{a_{L},\zeta_{z}}^{d,k} Global aggregated weights at cluster z𝑧z for client-side at round k𝑘k
𝐰¯aL,ζzs,ksuperscriptsubscript¯𝐰subscript𝑎𝐿subscript𝜁𝑧𝑠𝑘\bar{\mathbf{w}}_{a_{L},\zeta_{z}}^{s,k} Global aggregated weights at cluster z𝑧z for split server-side at round k𝑘k
GaL,ζzsubscript𝐺subscript𝑎𝐿subscript𝜁𝑧G_{a_{L},\zeta_{z}} Represents the filtered clients with available resources at cluster ζzsubscript𝜁𝑧\zeta_{z} at round k𝑘k
Θ∈(m​e​m,p​r​o,d​i​s)superscriptΘabsent𝑚𝑒𝑚𝑝𝑟𝑜𝑑𝑖𝑠\Theta^{\in(mem,pro,dis)} Represent the prediction model of resource utilization
references: The objective involves selecting a suitable group of clients (Xs,ζzKsuperscriptsubscript𝑋𝑠subscript𝜁𝑧𝐾X_{s,\zeta_{z}}^{K}) in every round k𝑘k of a cluster ζzsubscript𝜁𝑧\zeta_{z} from a diverse pool of available clients (Xal,ζzksuperscriptsubscript𝑋subscript𝑎𝑙subscript𝜁𝑧𝑘X_{a_{l},\zeta_{z}}^{k}). Each client has a different resource profile, label and data sample size. Our objectives include the number of data sample sizes each client has (Xa,ζzsam,k)X_{a,\zeta_{z}}^{\text{sam},k}), the number of selected devices (Xs,ζzksuperscriptsubscript𝑋𝑠subscript𝜁𝑧𝑘X_{s,\zeta_{z}}^{k}), the number of unique labels of the selected client devices u​(Xs,ζzk)𝑢superscriptsubscript𝑋𝑠subscript𝜁𝑧𝑘{u}(X_{s,\zeta_{z}}^{k}), the differences in the processing capabilities of the selected clients 𝐕​(Xu,ζzp​r​o​c,k)𝐕superscriptsubscript𝑋𝑢subscript𝜁𝑧𝑝𝑟𝑜𝑐𝑘\mathbf{V}(X_{u,\zeta_{z}}^{proc,k}) and finally to monitor the clients selected by tracking the historical client selected h​i​s​t​(Xs,ζzk)ℎ𝑖𝑠𝑡superscriptsubscript𝑋𝑠subscript𝜁𝑧𝑘{hist}(X_{s,\zeta_{z}}^{k}) so that no client device is left out of the training process. Clients are chosen based on their varying resource limitations, and their security goals are maintained. Each client is assigned unique labels and is responsible for optimizing their participation while ensuring the continuous authentication model’s maximum performance. Table 1 defines the summary of some important notations used.
